messages.message:
Cypress on call summary (Dec 9 to Dec 13):
- We discovered that because apps with ground truth sets can't be deleted (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1733862608551629), there was an increasing number of apps in the app list, causing deployment tests to fail since they try to scroll to find the app
- The fix: Jessica changed the deployments tests (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/66130) to use the search bar, so the cluttered apps list won't matter going forward
- I ran a script to manually clean it up (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1733867645252339?thread_ts=1733862608.551629&cid=CSY11CK7T); it will help prevent clutter
- ~Serena will rewrite the Cypress app deletion cleanup step someday to delete both ground truth sets and the app~  Serena already did it!
- We found a few tests that were flakey:
- downstream-integrations (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1734032391837539)
- review-manager-dashboard (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1734135758069419)
- file-list (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1734029277597139)
- We can have Udit take a look at the last two; maybe Paul can tackle downstream-integrations?

btw i already fixed the ground-truth-crud test to delete the ground truth set before deleting the app! see PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/65974/files#diff-e49d2b1def1cd63322387a84c2129df803c8a709dadb60f532c9d01789a8c978R43)
